qas.question: What three components make up Bottom Up Testing?
Bottom Up Testing helps facilitate the testing of what?

answers.text: the testing of higher level components

qas.question: What does Bottom Up Testing also help with once the process has been repeated over and over again at all levels?

answers.text: makes it easier to report testing progress in the form of a percentage

qas.question: When the highest level components are tested first, the testing process is called what?
What three components make up Bottom Down Testing?
This approach only works when half of the modules of the same what are ready?

plausible_answers.text: report testing progress in the form of a percentage

qas.question: Bottom Up Testing helps determine levels of software developed and makes it harder to complete what?

context: <b3_0>Bottom Up Testing<b3_0/> is an approach to integrated testing where the lowest level components (<a0_0><b4_0>modules, procedures, and functions<b4_0/><a0_0/>) are tested first, then integrated and used to facilitate <a1_0>the testing of higher level components<a1_0/>. After the integration testing of lower level integrated modules, the next level of modules will be formed and can be used for integration testing. The process is repeated until the components at the top of the hierarchy are tested. This approach is helpful only when all or most of the modules of the same <b5_0>development level<b5_0/> are ready.[citation needed] This method also helps to determine the levels of software developed and <a2_0>makes it easier to <b6_0>report testing progress in the form of a percentage<b6_0/><a2_0/>.[citation needed]
